com.upgrad.bde.assignment.datastructure

Class HashTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.upgrad.bde.assignment.datastructure.HashTable

  • public class HashTable
extends java.lang.Object
    The Hash Table class is an implementation of the Hash Table technique.

    • Field Detail

      • hashTable

        public static EVM[] hashTable
        For HashTable implementation, this is the data structure which is used for storing the EVM records.

        This data structure is used for the ADD() and FIND() operations.

      • loadFactor

        public static final double loadFactor
        For Hash Table implementation, this is the load factor used for rehashing the hash table data structure i.e. the hash table is automatically rehashed when the load in the hash table data structure is about to equate the load factor.

        This constant is used in calculating the load in a hash table.

        The value of this constant is set to 0.75 .

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • totalHTBucket

        public static int totalHTBucket
        For Hash Table implementation, this is the total bucket (array) size for the hash table data structure hashTable which is an array of type EVM .

        The initial size is set to 10 and the size is doubled to the next available prime number on every rehashing occasion.

      • totalVoteCountBucket

        public static int totalVoteCountBucket
        For Hash Table implementation, this is the total bucket (array) size for the hash table data structure voteCountHashTable which is an array of type VoteCount .

        The initial size is set to 10 and the size is doubled to the next available prime number on every rehashing occasion.

      • voteCountHashTable

        public static VoteCount[] voteCountHashTable
        For Hash Table implementation, this is the data structure which is used for storing the VoteCount records.

        This data structure is used for the COUNT() operation.

    • Constructor Detail

        public HashTable()

    • Method Detail

      • ADD

        public static void ADD(int voter_id,
                       short candidate_id)
        This method is an implementation of the ADD() operation for Hash Table. .

        It adds a record of type EVM into a hash table data structure of type EVM .

        The record consists of a voter_id and candidate_id .

        Using a hash function, an index location or bucket is identified where the record of type EVM is stored in a LinkedList.

        Here, the Separate Chaining technique for Collision Resolution is used.

        The new records of type EVM are added to the head of the LinkedList in order to avoid linear probing time while performing the ADD() operation.

        The worst case run time complexity for this operation is O(1) i.e. irrespective of the number of records, the time taken for adding a record is always constant.

        The hash table data structure is automatically rehashed by doubling the size of the data structure to the next available prime number.

        The rehashing operation is performed when:

        the load in the data structure is about to reach to the loadFactor AND

        before adding the record in the hash table.

        This method accepts Unique records i.e. the Key (voter_id) of each record is unique.

        Parameters:
        voter_id - is a 6 digit number of type int which acts as the Key for the record.
        candidate_id - is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Value of the record.

      • calculateVoterCount

        static void calculateVoterCount(short candidate_id)
        For Hash Table implementation, this is a helper method used for calculating total votes for all candidates.

        It adds a record of type VoteCount to a hash table data structure of type VoteCount , if the record with a particular Key (candidate_id) does not exists.

        By default, the Value (voter_count) for the record is set to 1.

        If the record with a particular Key (candidate_id) already exists in the data structure then the Value (voter_count) is incremented by 1.

        The method takes as input a Key (candidate_id) .

        Parameters:
        candidate_id - is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Key for storing the record.

      • COUNT

        public static int COUNT(short candidate_id)
        This method is an implementation of the COUNT() operation for Hash Table .

        It finds a record of type VoteCount from a hash table data structure of type VoteCount .

        It takes as input a Key (candidate_id) and returns the Value (voter_count) corresponding to the Key.

        It returns 0 if the record containing the Key (candidate_id) does not exist.

        Using a hash function, an index location or bucket is identified where the record of type VoteCount is stored in a LinkedList.

        If the LinkedList is empty then a Node of type VoteCount is added to the head node.

        By default, the Value (voter_count) is set to 1 when the node is added to the LinkedList.

        If the LinkedList is not empty then the LinkedList is linearly traversed to find the corresponding record.

        The Value (voter_count) is incremented by 1 for the existing record found during linear traversal.

        The worst case run time complexity for this operation is O(N) .

        The index or bucket holding the record is reached in constant time O(1)

        The LinkedList is linearly traversed to find the record which is O(N) if the record to be found is at the last node of the LinkedList.

        Therefore, O(1) + O(N) = O(N) is the worst case time complexity for the FIND() operation.

        Parameters:
        candidate_id - is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Key for finding the record.
        Returns:
        voter_count is an int which represents the total votes received by a particular candidate.

      • FIND

        public static short FIND(int voter_id)
        This method is an implementation of the FIND() operation for Hash Table .

        It finds a record of type EVM from a hash table data structure of type EVM .

        It takes as input a Key (voter_id) and returns the Value (candidate_id) corresponding to the Key.

        It returns 0 if the record containing the Key (voter_id) does not exist.

        Using a hash function, an index location or bucket is identified where the record of type EVM is stored in a LinkedList.

        The LinkedList is linearly traversed to find the corresponding record.

        The worst case run time complexity for this operation is O(N) .

        The index or bucket storing the record is reached in constant time O(1)

        Now the LinkedList is linearly traversed to find the corresponding record.

        The worst case run time complexity is O(N) if the record to be found is at the last node of the LinkedList.

        Therefore, O(1) + O(N) = O(N) is the worst case time complexity for the FIND() operation.

        Parameters:
        voter_id - is a 6 digit number of type int which acts as the Key for finding the record.
        Returns:
        candidate_id is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Value of the record.

      • getBucketIndex

        public static int getBucketIndex(int id,
                                 int bucketSize)
        For Hash Table implementation, this is a helper method used for identifying the index or bucket location within the hash table structure for storing or retrieving a record.

        The method takes as input a Key which is an ID.

        This could be the voter_id in case of EVM hash table data structure, OR

        This could be the candidate_id in case of VoteCount hash table data structure.

        This method takes as input a bucketSize of a hash table data structure.

        It returns the computed index or bucket location within the hash table structure.

        The index is computed using the following formula: index = Key.hashCode % bucketSize

        Parameters:
        id - is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Key for storing the record.
        bucketSize - is a number of type int which specifies the bucket size of the hash table, whose Key has to be hashed.
        Returns:
        an int which is the index or bucket location within the hash table data structure.

      • rehash

        public static void rehash()
        For Hash Table implementation, this is a helper method used for rehashing the hash table data structure i.e. increasing the size of the hash table when the load factor is about to be reached.

        This method increases the size of the bucket by doubling the bucket size to the next available prime number and rehashes all the existing elements and stores it in the hash table data structure.

        This method is implemented for the hash table data structure hashTable which is of type EVM .

      • rehashVoteCount

        public static void rehashVoteCount()
        For Hash Table implementation, this is a helper method used for rehashing the hash table data structure i.e. increasing the size of the hash table when the load factor is about to be reached.

        This method increases the size of the bucket by doubling the bucket size to the next available prime number and rehashes all the existing elements and stores it in the hash table data structure.

        This method is implemented for the hash table data structure voteCountHashTable which is of type VoteCount .
